snippet: Islamists set upon homes and churches, shops and schools as Christians were scapegoated for supporting the military ouster of Mohamed Morsi as president.
abstract: Islamists launch attacks on Egypt's Coptic Christian minority, destroying homes, shops and churches and killing at least three people, as Christians are scapegoated for supporting military ouster of Mohamed Morsi; government is trying to capitalize on attacks to paint Morsi's supporters as terrorists, but at same time does nothing to help Christians.
lead_paragraph: Islamists set upon homes and churches, shops and schools as Christians were scapegoated for supporting the military ouster of Mohamed Morsi as president.
